'''Brodda's hall''', or the '''Hall of Brodda''', was the dwelling of the [[Easterlings|Easterling]] [[Brodda]] and his wife [[Aerin]], who he forcefully wedded after the invasion of Dor-lómin in [[First Age 472|472]] of the First Age.<ref name="CoH">{{CH|12}}</ref>

[[File:Olga_Kalinichenko_-_Brodda_and_Aerin.jpg|thumb|right|"Brodda and Aerin" by Olga Kalinichenko]]

When [[Túrin]] returned to [[Dor-lómin]] in {{FA|496}} he confronted Brodda in his halls, where he is also reunited with his old friend [[Sador]]. In his rage Túrin killed Brodda, thereby sealing Aerin's fate, who burnt herself alive in her hall. 
After this incident the remainder of the [[House of Hador]] were persecuted with even greater cruelty.<ref name="CoH" />
